remarks: A prefix of a concatenation is either a prefix of the first concatenated word or a concatenation of the first word with a prefix of the second word.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Mar-2018.)  (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 29-May-2018.)
statement:
swrdccatin12.l $e |- L = ( # ` A ) $.
swrdccat3a $p |- ( ( A e. Word V /\ B e. Word V ) -> ( N e. ( 0 ... ( L + ( # ` B ) ) ) -> ( ( A ++ B ) substr <. 0 , N >. ) = if ( N <_ L , ( A substr <. 0 , N >. ) , ( A ++ ( B substr <. 0 , ( N - L ) >. ) ) ) ) ) $.
